Class ServerThread

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
ServerThread
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class ServerThread
extends java.lang.Thread
This class when instantiated will make a new thread, accept the incoming message from the socket, route it with the different options and responds with appropriate output for the different methods.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Disambiguation function. Gets the input from the socket (it has to be a String array), calls the right function, returns result.
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class java.lang.Thread

    • login

      public static User login​(java.lang.String email, java.lang.String password)
      Checks if the user with the selected email and password is present in the database.
      Parameters:
      email - the email of the User. [String]
      password - the password of the User. [String]
      Returns:
      User object. null_user if the account is not registered or the password is wrong, else the correct User.
      See Also:
      User

    • addWine

      public static Wine addWine​(java.lang.String name, int year, java.lang.String producer, java.lang.String grapes, java.lang.String notes)
      Allows to add a wine to the wine table contained in the database. It checks first if the wine the employee is trying to add is already present or not. If so, it returns a null_wine (operation not successful), otherwise it adds the new wine to the database and then creates the object Wine of the wine just added.
      Parameters:
      name - of the Wine. [String]
      year - of production of the Wine. [int]
      producer - of the Wine. [int]
      grapes - used for the Wine. [String]
      notes - notes for the Wine. [String]
      Returns:
      the object Wine of the wine inserted if the insertion has been successful or a null_wine if not. [Wine]
      See Also:
      Wine

    • register

      public static User register​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String surname, java.lang.String mail, java.lang.String password, int permission)
      Checks if the user with the selected email is present in the database. Then, if not, it registers the person with the selected permission.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the User. [String]
      surname - the surname of the User. [String]
      mail - the email of the User. [String]
      password - the password of the User. [String]
      permission - the permission of the User. [String]
      Returns:
      User object. null_user if the account is already registered, else the correct User.
      See Also:
      User

    • getOrders

      public static java.util.ArrayList<Order> getOrders​(java.lang.String... user)
      This method can be used in two ways:
      • no parameters: returns all the Orders
      • two parameters: if the second parameter is 1, it will return all the Orders made by the specified user in the first parameter. Else, it will return all the unshipped Orders.
      Parameters:
      user - [optional] Argument 1: email of the user. [String] Argument 2: permission. [String]
      Returns:
      ArrayList with all the Orders. [ArrayList of Order]
      See Also:
      User, Order

    • restock

      public static java.lang.Boolean restock​(int id, int new_quantity)
      Allows to restock a wine by adding to the existing quantity a new quantity specified by the employee. It returns the true if the operation is successful, otherwise it returns the false.
      Parameters:
      id - of the Wine. [int]
      new_quantity - the quantity that we want to restock. [int]
      Returns:
      true if the wine has been restocked, false if the wine has not been restocked for whatever reason. [Boolean]
      See Also:
      Wine

    • search

      public static java.util.ArrayList<Wine> search​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String year_string)
      Responds with a list with all the wines corriponding to the given search constraints. The research can be done either by year, by name or both of the Wine. Once the wines are found, their corrisponding objects are added to a list which is then returned.
      Parameters:
      name - of the wine to search. [String]
      year_string - of the wine to search. [String]
      Returns:
      ArrayList with all the Wines found. [ArrayList of Wine]
      See Also:
      Wine

    • addToCart

      public static java.lang.Boolean addToCart​(java.lang.String email, int id, int quantity)
      Allows the User to add a quantity of a Wine to the cart. It returns the true if the operation is successful, else the false.
      Parameters:
      email - of the User adding to the cart. [String]
      id - of the Wine. [int]
      quantity - the quantity that the User wants to buy. [int]
      Returns:
      true if the wine has been added to the cart, false if the wine has not been added to the cart for whatever reason. [Boolean]
      See Also:
      User, Wine

    • getNotifications

      public static java.util.ArrayList<Wine> getNotifications​(java.lang.String email)
      Gets all the notifications from the notifications' table where the email's field in the table corrisponds with the given User's email. It returns a ArrayList of Wine containing all the wines the User need to be notificated for.
      Parameters:
      email - of the User. [String]
      Returns:
      the ArrayList with the Wine the User needs to be notificated for. [ArrayList of Wine]
      See Also:
      User, Wine
